basics.name: Pan Ziyue
basics.Research Interests: Aerospace Avionics and Subsystems, Electronics Engineering and embedded systems, Remote sensing, Earth sciences (geospatial applications), Robotics, Astronomy

work.name: FourierIndustries (startup)
work.summary: Co-founded a startup company during middle school developing apps for the school, which later expanded to embedded hardware design for education and 3D printing services.
highlights: Developed in-house applications for the school from 2013 to 2015: SST Announcer (RSS feed viewer), Places@SST - (Bluetooth-based indoor navigation), SST Open House 2014 (Official school open house app), SST Lens (Simple photo editing application)
Developed the SPEEEduino, a modular IoT-enabled AVR+ESP8266 microcontroller platform for Singapore Polytechnic, which won a tender for 500 pieces in 2017

Developed the SSTuino (2018-2021) and SSTuino II (2022-present), an educational IoT-capable AVR+ESP32 microcontroller board targeting secondary schools, custom built for the School of Science and Technology, Singapore

work.name: Earth Observatory of Singapore
work.summary: Interned at the Earth Observatory of Singapore in NTU for 22 weeks.
highlights: Assisted in the consolidation and stabilization of the Microsoft Azure port of the Hybrid Science Data System (HySDS), working in collaboration with NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). HySDS is a highly scalable, hybrid cloud platform for scientific computation, with a particular focus on processing data from earth observation satellites.

work.name: Satellite Research Center (Nanyang Technological University)
work.summary: Interned at the Satellite Research Centre (SaRC) in NTU for 6 weeks during the March-April semester break to gain a deeper understanding of micro/nanosatellite engineering.
highlights: Developed the ORBITAL, a cross-platform desktop application written in Java to help highlight anomalies in satellite orbital data of the VELOX-II nanosatellite.

work.name: buUuk Pte. Ltd.
highlights: Interned at buUuk Pte. Ltd. for half a month in February of 2016 to gain more experience about professional mobile development companies in Singapore, and aided in the development of one of their client projects.

education.institution: Singapore University of Technology and Design
courses: Computer Engineering specialisation, Double Minor in Computer Science and Digital Humanities
GPA 4.18/5.0, SUTD Global Distinguished Scholarship Holder
GPA 3.965/4.0, Director’s Honour Roll AY2016/17, AY2017/18
Founding Vice President of SP Maker’s Club

awards.title: Apple WWDC 2014 Scholarship
awards.summary: The Apple WWDC scholarship is awarded to 200 students worldwide and grants a free ticket to Apple's Worldwide Developer's Conference in San Francisco.

awards.title: Bronze - Singapore Science and Engineering Fair
awards.awarder: Ministry of Education (MOE), Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and Science Centre Singapore (SCS)
awards.summary: Achieved the Bronze Award in the Singapore Science and Engineering Fair with the AQILITY Internet-connected multi-parameter air quality monitoring system.

skills.name: Software Frameworks
keywords: System Administration: Red Hat and Debian Linux based systems
Mobile app development: iOS and Android native SDKs
Space platforms simulation: AGI Systems Tool Kit (Level 2 certified)

skills.name: Embedded Platforms
keywords: Platforms: Atmel AVR microcontrollers, RP2040 ARM microcontrollers, ESP32 Wi-Fi-capable microcontrollers

skills.name: Programming Languages
keywords: General purpose: Python, C, C++, Java
Mobile app development: Swift, Kotlin, Objective C
Web Technologies: TypeScript and JavaScript, PHP 7

projects.name: Electric Vehicle by Additive Manufacturing (EVAM 1.0) | Electronics Lead
projects.summary: EVAM 1.0 is the flagship project of the Electric Vehicle club in SUTD, which aims to build a completely functional, full scale electric vehicle for motorsports.
highlights: Built and tested a redesigned vehicle electronics system, with the main aim of improving data transfer reliability and preventing accidental drop-out of individual nodes.
Mentored fellow students on the team on electronics CAD design.

projects.name: Project Mynah | Team Member, Avionics
projects.summary: Project Mynah is the first amateur rocket built by students from various Singaporean universities.
highlights: Built, debugged and tested commercially available amateur rocketry flight computers for use in the Friends of Amateur Rocketry competition (2023), including software and radio aspects. The Project Mynah team was awarded 3rd place in the competition.

projects.name: Non-industrial Decomposition Of PLA Plastics | Team Member
projects.summary: This brief technical investigation aims to uncover sustainability claims made by 3D printing PLA filament manufacturers.
highlights: Developed embedded RP2040 CircuitPython code for Internet-based data logging and Jupyter notebook based code for experimental data analysis. In addition, sun tracking analysis was completed using AGI Systems Tool Kit.

projects.name: Airbus-SSTA HADR Challenge | Team Member
highlights: Winner of the 2018 Airbus-SSTA Humanitarian Aid and Disaster Relief Challenge, organised by Airbus Defence & Space in collaboration with the Singapore Space and Technology Association. Tasked with developing an Android application that increases the efficiency and effectiveness of Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief operations.

projects.name: SSTuino | Designer
projects.summary: An educational Arduino-compatible IoT microcontroller custom built for the School of Science and Technology, Singapore
